intro: Lipotriche richardsiae, commonly known as the Richardsia lipotrich, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a perennial herb native to the high-altitude regions of South America, particularly in the Andes. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, typical of many members of its family. Lipotriche richardsiae is known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in local remedies for various ailments.
